alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Franklin; Jefferson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 6:32AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Franklin, southeastern Jefferson and Douglas Counties through 715 AM CDT... At 631 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles southeast of Perry Lake to 3 miles northwest of Lawrence to Centropolis. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lawrence, Baldwin City, Oskaloosa, Eudora, Wellsville, Centropolis, Perry, McLouth, Lecompton, Clinton, Lone Star, Pleasant Grove, Vinland, Williamstown, Perry Lake, Clinton Lake and Globe. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 197 and 198. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 191 and 205. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
